 The "deficit" is just an accounting term that describes the event when the government collects less money then it spends. If the fiscal year ends in a deficit situation, then that amount is included in the "national debt" figure. The DEBT that the US gov. enters into is financed by the sale of US gov. bonds. The bond holders 'own' the debt. Fortunatly, much of the debt (bonds) are held by our own people.
